content.description:
Start as

Hell or High Water

, but instead of engaging the crimps in the face, use an undercling to reach up and left to a tufa. Match here, and head right onto water polished crimps and a long move to meet back up with the

Hell or High Water

topout.
content.location: See Hell or High Water Wall.

content.description:
Traverse in from the left side of the wall for about 20 feet into a ledge large enough to get a long rest. Move around the arete onto some small crimps on the overhanging face and climb straight up.

The water is deep here, but it's still a good idea to test the depth before committing to the top.
content.location: This is visible from the road. The traverse starts right near the most commonly used river crossing. It's the large overhanging orange-ish face with aretes on both sides.

content.description:
SWIM! into the corner of the right side of the wall. Pull into the shelf, and attempt to dry off. From here, do a double clutch dyno to a pancake-shaped ledge. Then trend up and left into the

Hell or High Water

topout.
content.location:
See

Hell or High Water Wall

.

content.description: The Boulder is tThe furthest most right climb on the wall. Swim into the pedestal, grab a bucket jug with slabby feet, compress the refrigerator arete, and engage a mantel before heading up and right via a crack to the top.
content.location: See Hell or High Water Wall.

content.description:
Traverse into the rest of

Hell or High Water

, then climb up the crack to another no hands rest. From here, dyno straight backwards, double clutching the jug lip at 25 feet.

This is one of the most thrilling dynos in CO... it loses a star for the contrivance, as you can continue climbing the crack out left.
content.location:
See

Hell or High Water Wall

.

content.description:
Swim into the shelf to the right of

Hell or High Water

, and traverse the left seem to the top. Three separate mantels and no hands rest get you to the far left side of the wall.
content.location: See Hell or High Water Wall.
